{"pk": 4, "path": "000100020001", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Funder Guide", "draft_title": "Funder Guide", "slug": "funder-guide", "content_type": 80, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/guides/funder-guide/", "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2018-08-31T11:09:43.257Z", "live_revision": null, "intro": "

Hello.

Thanks for checking out Gitcoin. Gitcoin is a network of distributed smart contracts, based upon Ethereum, that provides tools for repo maintainers like yourself to push their repos forward.

Kevin Owocki - @owocki

ADD IMAGE: kevin-owocki

", "sections": "[{\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Can Gitcoin help my repo?\", \"paragraph\": \"

If you have an issues board that needs triaged, read on..

If you would like to recruit engineers to help work on your repo, read on..

If you are looking for a quick win, an easy buck, or to promote something, please turn around.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"c004f1ee-a26e-4134-8291-c5fa1a45159d\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"How can I post a bounty on Gitcoin?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Check out this tutorial:

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"ce6ccc43-ea54-471a-8b66-f72c975c3749\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"What is the high level bounty flow on Gitcoin?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Emails sent only when a search comes up that actually matches.

This feature can be accessed from the Issue Explorer.

ADD IMAGE:Bounty FLow.png

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"16539bb7-326f-4f0c-b1a0-b2d566b4e1a6\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Can I tip developers in ethereum for their work?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Yes, head on over to gitcoin.co/tip. The tipping system supports ETH or any ERC20 token.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"e399ae22-ed2a-4771-be36-1da3c07d6a74\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Which issues are good candidates for funded issues?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Gitcoin supports bug, feature and security funded issues. Any issue that you need done is a good candidate for a funded issue, provided that:

  • It's open today.
  • The repo README clearly enumerates how a new developer should get set up to contribute.
  • The task is well defined.
  • The end-state of the task is well defined.
  • The pricing of the task reflects (market rate * complexity) of the task.
  • The issue is on the roadmap, but does not block other future work in the roadmap.
  • Skunkworks projects that you don't want to staff up on.

To get started with funded issues today, it might be good to start small. Is there a small bug that needs fixed? An issue that's been open for a while that no one is tackling? An administrative task?

Check out your repo and come back, I'll wait :)

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"c0d94724-434b-44ea-b79b-d7f49dea8876\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"How do I prepare my repo for contributions?\", \"paragraph\": \"

In order for developers to turnaround features or bugs for your repo, they will need to be set up with a basic environment to develop upon.

We recommend creating a CONTRIBUTING.md file (Here is a good example.) that details all of:

  • How to set up a dev environment (or, alternatively, providing a docker container with a working dev environment)
  • Documenting the architecture of any major subsystems of the repo.
  • Outlining a 'hello world' type example wherein something small is changed and the user can execute and see some difference in the output.
  • Documenting the pull request acceptance guidelines.

If you want feedback on your CONTRIBUTING.md file, feel free to contact the Gitcoin Core team: founder@gitcoin.co.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"f178dd7e-9871-4d95-94bd-0fc7a099b6dc\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Where do developers discover funded issues?\", \"paragraph\": \"

The main way folks discover bounties are:

  1. Issue Explorer
  2. Signing up for the gitcoin email list
  3. for every new funded issue that's posted, if it's not processed in a day or two, the Gitcoin Core team may do outreach to a network of devs we know with those skillsets. This is subject to the funded issue being reasonably priced and success being achievable.
  4. Optional: Funded Issue Readme cross-promo FIXME

It's still early days, but Gitcoin Core' focus is to make sure Repo Owners get their bounties processed if they're reasonable and published to the system. Or if you don't, you get your token/eth back.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"2703b692-bc57-46cf-b5eb-4316e805806c\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"How can Gitcoin help my repo TODAY?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Gitcoin can help you grow your repository if you:

  • Post a funded issue
  • Tip other developers
  • Let people know your repo supports funded issues FIXME
  • Add your token to Gitcoin FIXME

To see an end to end video of the issue funding flow, please view the video: Leverage A Worldwide Workforce in 90 Seconds.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"48927826-c72f-4de3-9dbc-f9b4c6b7d559\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"How can Gitcoin help my repo in the future?\", \"paragraph\": \"

That's an open question. See something Gitcoin Core should be doing? Contact us, especially if you're looking to provide value back to the open source ecosystem.

\", \"html\": \"\\r\\n
\\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n
\"}, \"id\": \"68e94940-e2d0-4a80-ad9f-65a20467944e\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Other helpful stuff\", \"paragraph\": \"\", \"html\": \"\\r\\n

{"pk": 5, "path": "000100020002", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Developer Guide", "draft_title": "Developer Guide", "slug": "developer-guide", "content_type": 81, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/guides/developer-guide/", "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2018-08-31T11:09:57.951Z", "live_revision": null, "intro": "

Hello.

Thanks for checking out Gitcoin. Gitcoin is a network of distributed smart contracts, based upon Ethereum, that provides tools for developers like yourself to get more into open source, mint some coin, and collaborate with other smart people.

Kevin Owocki - @owocki

ADD IMAGE: kevin-owocki

", "sections": "[{\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Can Gitcoin help me?\", \"paragraph\": \"

If you want to make a few bucks, read on.

If you want to provide value, read on.

If you want to work on problems with other smart people, read on.

If you are looking for a way to get more into open source, read on.

If you are looking for a quick win, an easy buck, or to promote something, please turn around.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"17636e47-fb42-469e-b0fd-3a73d7e83ef4\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Where do I start?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Gitcoin supports bug, feature and security bounties. We try to encourage issues with the following qualities:

  • It's open today.
  • The repo README clearly enumerates how a new developer should get set up to contribute.
  • The task is well defined.
  • The end-state of the task is well defined.

To get started, check out the Issue Explorer. It's a searchable index of bounties that have been submitted to the blockchain.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"7890b4b6-90d8-4853-a884-afa7a5ac6d12\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Can I tip other developers in ether for their work?\", \"paragraph\": \"

Yes, the tipping system supports ETH or any ERC20 token. Head on over to gitcoin.co/tip or check out this youtube video:

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"90f883e1-3f10-4b4a-a8a6-2dd21cffb03c\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Sign up for notifications when new jobs match your skillset.\", \"paragraph\": \"

Emails sent only when a search comes up that actually matches.

This feature can be accessed from the Issue Explorer.

ADD IMAGE: screenshot of explorer

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"1094f173-6e2e-44b5-93f9-43d1557b87e3\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Can I be notified when new bounties are posted?\", \"paragraph\": \"

The main way folks discover bounties are:

  1. Issue Explorer
  2. Signing up for the gitcoin email list
  3. for every new funded issue that's posted, if it's not processed in a day or two, the Gitcoin Core team may do outreach to a network of devs we know with those skillsets. This is subject to the funded issue being reasonably priced and success being achievable.
  4. Optional: Funded Issue Readme cross-promo FIXME

It's still early days, but Gitcoin Core' focus is to make sure Repo Owners get their bounties processed if they're reasonable and published to the system. Or if you don't, you get your token/eth back.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"01f41de3-969f-4ac1-82be-fff301c73e3e\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Working Your First Issue\", \"paragraph\": \"

By this point, you might have poked around the Issue Explorer and found a project you'd be interested in claiming! If so, you'll follow the following steps:

Starting Work

  • Click 'Start Work' to kick off a message to the repo-maintainer that you're interested in the issue.
  • Respond on the Github thread with your intended approach for the bounty.

Making a Submission

  • Download MetaMask
    MetaMask is a bridge that allows you to visit the distributed web in your browser, today. Specifically here, it allows Gitcoin (an Ethereum dApp) to run in your browser so you can use gas to claim an issue!
  • Get some ETH (gas) in order to make a submission
    What is gas, you say? FIXME
    If you need a small amount to make a claim, check out the Gitcoin Faucet
  • Click on 'Submit Work', use your gas to make a submission!


From here, you should be off to the races! The repo maintainer will review your PR and pay out accordingly. Feel free to poke your head in if you have any issues.

\", \"html\": \"\"}, \"id\": \"a3aa9e65-3f06-4cc8-a814-36c511dd6960\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Gitcoin is Open Source, and it's being built with Gitcoin.\", \"paragraph\": \"

Dogfooding! Yay! See something Gitcoin Core should be doing? Contact us, especially if you're looking to provide value back to the open source ecosystem.

\", \"html\": \"\\r\\n
\\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n \\r\\n
\"}, \"id\": \"fd0bf085-9e60-4347-bb2a-e8fdb7b876a5\"}, {\"type\": \"section\", \"value\": {\"heading\": \"Other helpful stuff\", \"paragraph\": \"\", \"html\": \"\\r\\n
